title: Squirrel on a wire part - d

content.description: A squirrel starts at building A at time t=0 and travels along a straight,horizontal wire connected to building B. For 0≤t≤18 , the squirrel's velocity is modeled by the piecewise-linear function defined by the graph above.
content.question: Write expressions for the squirrel's acceleration a(t), velocity v(t), and distance x(t) from building A that are valid for the time interval 7<t<10.

frqParts.text: Write expressions for the squirrel's acceleration a(t), velocity v(t), and distance x(t) from building A that are valid for the time interval 7<t<10.

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
